alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 12:59PM MST until December 02 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Kit Carson County in east central Colorado... * Until 130 PM MST. * At 1258 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 4 miles south of Kanorado to 15 miles south of Burlington to 15 miles northeast of Boyero, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar and satellite imagery. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 170 and 206, and near mile marker 211. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Stratton, Flagler, Seibert, Bethune and Vona. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
